attributes.action: Close all retail stores on New Year's Day
attributes.background: New Year's Day is the day after we celebrate the year before and can't do that if we are at work

attributes.action: Call on the Government not to spend further public money on the Olympic stadium.
attributes.background:
The original structure became the new home of West Ham United from last August. The conversion costs £272m, of which the football club will pay just £15m plus annual rent of £2.5m, bringing the final price tag to £702m. 

Problems with the seating will now cost the tax payer more millions to fix
attributes.additional_details: The government preferred to produce a brief for an athletics only stadium which would be largely disassembled after the games with the lower tier remaining in place as a permanent athletics facility to replace the Crystal Palace National Sports Centre. With the original Olympic design finalised and being built, the government had a change of heart and a bidding process for a multi-sport post-Olympic legacy was launched.

attributes.action: Lower the curfew of fireworks to 9pm on a normal night
attributes.background: The curfew for fireworks should be lowered to 9pm on a normal night because little children go to bed at 9pm & dogs will not be afraid for too long & their owners will be able to get to sleep not worrying about there pets.

attributes.action: I would like the Government to reinstate Child Support Agency!
attributes.background: We need a government run Child Support Agency as the so called Child Maintenance Service is not meeting the correct criteria. Causing a high level of financial suffering for the parent who is raising the child/children. The absent parent is not being forced to supply correct financial  information.

attributes.action: i would like to propose one day a year where all commercial flights are banned.
attributes.background: Reports have been released showing the extent that the flight ban after 9/11 had on climate change. These reports show promising figures of an overall drop of average temperature. I believe that by banning non necessary and commercial flights for one day a year could help to slow down global warming
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.greenmedinfo.com/blog/artificial-weather-revealed-post-9-11-flight-groundings 
http://globalnews.ca/news/2934513/empty-skies-after-911-set-the-stage-for-an-unlikely-climate-change-experiment/
i have supplied two sources which both support my claim however many more are available with a simple google search.

attributes.action: All councils and H/A should offer any new build properties to existing tenants
attributes.background: all councils and associations should offer new build properties to existing tenants who have lived in older properties for over 10 years and are up to date with the rent accounts in order for them to be able to upgrade and older properties offered to new tenants
attributes.additional_details: Social housing tenants are stuck now if you want to move it's pretty much a no go unless you have exceptional circumstances you could do mutual exchange but if you are in a older house there's little Chance as most want new builds if councils were to offer new builds to existing long term tenants it would mean that if they wanted to upgrade or move area the choice is there new tenants to be offered the older properties

attributes.action: Make all retail and commercial premises prominently display their street numbers
attributes.background: Most shops and commercial premises fail to display their street numbers at all, making it very difficult to find them by address. This adds to high street congestion, pollution and potential for accidents by distracted drivers. Prominently displaying their street number should be a legal requirement

attributes.action: Dedicate more funds to the development of the city of Birmingham.
attributes.background: Too much of the British economy is centered around London. To counter this I suggest dedicating funds to the improvement and expansion of the city of Birmingham as it already has a substantial population, and has the potential to become a new economic and financial hub, strengthening the economy.
attributes.additional_details: The city of San Francisco in the U.S is a major tourist attraction and financial hub, yet it is smaller than Birmingham. If the government was too attract more buisnesses to the area, build more attractions and increase the amount of tall buildings to make it appear more of a global city, then I believe we would see a similar effect. Expanding the airport to fly directly to more cities would also bolster this effect. This would generate far more revenue and give Britain a substantial 2nd city.

attributes.action: removal of traffic commissioners powers to suspend, revoke driving licences
attributes.background: when you get an offence like an TS10 and after you have paid the fixed penalty and received the points, you are called up to the traffic commissioner nearly 3 years after the fact and she decides to suspend your licence while under a high court ruling this can only happen for a maximum of 21 days.
attributes.additional_details: the traffic  has suspended licences for 22 years according to DVLA they have had letters from VOSA through the traffic commissioner to suspend a licence until the holder is 70 years of age under current law this can only be done for a maximum of 21 day through a high court ruling or 12 month through the totting up of more that 12 penalty points

attributes.action: Require manufacturers & suppliers to label reduction in size/volume of a product
attributes.background: Since the economic downturn in 2009, manufacturers & suppliers of food & other consumer goods such as washing liquids have been reducing the size or volume of products whilst maintaining the same selling price or increasing it. This results in the consumer paying more money for less goods.
attributes.additional_details: Often the reductions are so subtle, that a consumer is unaware that anything has changed. This practice is misleading & unfair & it is time that manufacturers & suppliers are required to clearly mark a reduction in size or volume. This practice has made the weekly shop much more expensive & by labelling the reduction in size, consumers will be better informed to look at alternative products that may offer better value for money. See examples in this Daily Mail article: https://goo.gl/0aUpQF

attributes.action: To change the education system to ensure all students benefit
attributes.background:
What needs to be done: 
-	The amount of memorization needed to do well in the subject needs to be reduced.
-	Courses should focus more on coursework due to the stress of exams.
-	The core subjects need to be changed in order to benefit the child outside of qualification.
attributes.additional_details:
A focus on memorization leads to a bias towards students who have a good memory, but not necessarily a good understanding. The amount of information needed to memorise has recently been increased by Ofqual.

Coursework has recently been removed completely from all non-practical subjects. This increases stress drastically to the point where it may have physical effects. Many students also struggle to perform under stressful conditions which means they do not get results that reflect their ability.

attributes.action: Prevent reverse charging on mobile phone contracts unless consent is given first
attributes.background: The current laws allow anyone with your mobile number, who sets up a business through the regulator, to charge you too "Receive" texts that cost you money without your consent.  Some of these are on the proviso that you opt-out of something you haven't even requested.
attributes.additional_details:
It should not be possible to charge you to receive texts until the user has opted-in, by responding to a text message instead of just receiving it, and mobile network operators should be forced to disable reverse charge billing if requested by the bill payer.

Mobile network operators should also be made to publish their involvement in these companies as well as the profits that they make from them as there is clearly a conflict of interest.

attributes.action: Restrict private parking charges to reasonable amounts.
attributes.background: It is proposed that the government amend the Protection of Freedom Act 2014 to restrict the amount a private company can issue a parking charge to a fair and reasonable amount and no more than what the local council can issue a penalty notice.
attributes.additional_details:
Every day many parking charge notices are issued to vehicles parking on private land. Normally, the fee to cover the car is a reasonable nominal amount. However, for those that overstay the period the vehicle is covered or parking the car without any cover the charges are unreasonable and far more than the loss of business the proprietor suffers. 

The everyday person in the United Kingdom that uses parking facilities lawfully but from time to time cannot cover their car for entirely adequate reasons are suffering unreasonable financial burdens.

attributes.action: Have one NHS distribution centre and buying in bulk whilst making cheaper deals.
attributes.background: We need to have one NHS distribution centre sending all the medical equipment and medicines to each individual hospital. Buying in bulk,getting better and more controled deals. Stoping different hospitals paying different prices,hopefully saving millions. The NHS deserves a better deal,and so do we!

attributes.action: If 20% of a workforce are claiming tax credits  no dividend to shareholders
attributes.background: Any Company  paying its workers so low that they are subsidizing their wages with tax credits, should be barred from paying a dividend. The taxpayer should not be propping up greedy bosses that should  be paying correct wages  to the workers not  to shareholders

attributes.action: Save Kingfisher Ward and Scbu at Dorchester County Hospital!!
attributes.background: The facilities for the care of very small babies and children are due to be cut drastically. This will involve having to travel at least an hour to get the medical care needed. This is just quite frankly ridiculous!! Time in an emergency is one of the key factors in the best chances of survival.

attributes.action: Failed Senior NHS Managers should NOT be re-employed in the NHS
attributes.background: Southern Healthcare Foundation Trust have continued to employ failed Chief Executive

attributes.action:
make it mandatory to show on ALL products:
- manufacturer
- origin
attributes.background:
Please make it mandatory for all products sold in the UK to display
- manufacturer name
- country of origin
this should apply to products sold under supermarkets' name as well.
for example 
fridge from electronic shop chain named Sandstorm does not show manufacturer and its country of origin!

attributes.action: Introduce a "safe for the road" certification system for both riders and horses.
attributes.background: Horses are large animals and potentially dangerous on the roads, especially  to pedestrians and cyclists. The level of rider skill, and the temperament of the animals is enormously varied. Most horse riders are able and considerate but a significant minority are not.

attributes.action: Transfer the drug cannabis from class B to class C
attributes.background: In January 2004, cannabis was transferred from class B to class C and was reclassified in January 2009 as a class B drug, which went against the ACMD's advice on the classification of the drug. Classifying cannabis as a class C drug would save the police both time and money.

attributes.action: HMG has significant forces in FRG. Gov. to debate redeploying BFG to Gibraltar.
attributes.background: HM Government at some considerable cost to the British taxpayer maintains a significant military presence in Germany in the form of British Forces Germany (BFG).  Germany is the richest EU country and not being directly threatened or indeed sited adjacent any potential hostile nation.
attributes.additional_details: In light of the EU's response to our PM's Article 50 notification, and in view of Germany not being directly threatened or indeed sited adjacent any potential hostile nation, Parliament should debate the redeployment of significant elements of BFG from Germany to potential conflict zones where British interests at likely to be directly threatened e.g. Gibraltar.  The German Government freed from the comforting cloak of foreign protective power might then be stimulated to pay for its own defence.

attributes.action: EU immigrants arriving after article 50 must return home when we leave the EU
attributes.background: Immigrants who arrive after article 50 starts must return home once we fully leave the EU

attributes.action: Require Ofcom to update the market classifications of telephone exchanges.
attributes.background: The Ofcom classification of telephone exchanges was first done in 2010, and is out of date. Thousands of people are being forced to pay inflated prices for broadband because their local exchange is classified as market 1 with BT Wholesale as the only LLP when there are 4 or more active LLP on site.
attributes.additional_details: I have done market research and many exchanges all over the country are still market 1. The criteria for a market 1 exchange is that BT Wholesale is the sole Local Loop Provider. Many exchanges now have three or more LLP on site and operating from these exchanges. There appears to be collusion between BT and Ofcom to keep many hundreds of exchanges in market 1 and not to upgrade then to market 2 or 3. This is forcing thousand of customers to pay excessive charges for their broad band service.

attributes.action: Make the use of mobile pay via drive through exempt from the mobile driving law
attributes.background:
With the new enforcement of the mobile driving law, an individual found using their mobile device will be liable for a fine of upto £200 and 6 pts on their license.

This means any individual using Apple pay/mobile payment methods at a drive through such as KFC/McDonalds are in breach of the law.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.dailystar.co.uk/tech/news/601350/McDonalds-drive-thru-fine-driving-ban-Apple-Pay

attributes.action: 50% off sanitary items for all females aged 22 & under, and in education
attributes.background: Products such as pads and tampons are an essential for menstruating women. However, many young females find that they are too expensive, and as a result, struggle to find the money to purchase them. In a Western, developed country, this should never be the case; these items are a right.
attributes.additional_details: Sexual intercourse is a choice. The shedding of a female's uterus lining is not. If condoms can be accessed freely then surely feminine hygiene products can be purchased at a discounted price.

attributes.action: MSPs should be stopped from also holding a seat & voting in the House of Commons
attributes.background:
Scottish MSPs should be prohibited from also holding a seat and voting in the House of Commons.
MSP's are voted for by their constituents in Scotland, their salaries are paid by the Scottish Government, they should therefore not be able to vote in the House of Commons.

attributes.action: Ensure the EHIC will remain available to UK citizens after exit from the EU.
attributes.background:
The European Health Insurance Card is relied upon by many UK citizens to access medical care when abroad within Europe. 
For many travelers with health conditions this allows us to take affordable travel insurance without having to declare pre-exisiting medical conditions.
attributes.additional_details: For many people with serious or chronic health conditions travel insurance can be incredibly expensive or insurers refuse to cover your condition. This can make travel insurance difficult to organise or a choice having to be made as to whether you cover your condition at great cost, or hope for the best. If EHIC becomes unavailable for British citizens after Brexit it is likely insurance costs will significantly increase as insurers will be footing the bill rather than through the EHIC system.

attributes.action: Cancel  HS2 & modernise the entire UK rail network, replacing the diesel fleet.
attributes.background:
Electrification of all UK rail infrastructure would allow diesel trains to be phased out. 
Electrification will reduce emissions in UK cities; huge diesel's run whilst sat in stations & emit whilst travelling. 
diesel stock doesn't have effective  emission control and emits NOx and particles.
attributes.additional_details:
Bidders on HS2 could be directed to modernise current rail networks by provision of dual lines & upgrading rolling stock to bring faster, cleaner, faster journeys and to make available to all UK citizens and not just few who may use the HS2 route.

Fast journeys are already possible on Pendolino trains, this should cover the current network before HS2.

Think of stations including Euston and Paddington with zero diesel fumes!

https://academic.oup.com/jnci/article-lookup/doi/10.1093/jnci/djs034

attributes.action: Bring back the Intermediate Tier for the new Maths GCSE Specification
attributes.background: I feel that the new Maths Specification will inevitably fail all the 16 year old's who find the Foundation tier too easy, yet suffer at the difficulty of the Higher tier as the two papers clearly don't cater for the students who are in this predicament.

attributes.action: Change the number system of the UK from a decimal to a dozenal/duodecimal system
attributes.background: A base 12 number system (with 12 separate symbols for numbers to 12) would provide a much easier counting system to the current decimal system due to the increased number of factors that 12 has. This would make multiplying and dividing much easier in everyday life.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.dozenalsociety.org.uk/
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=U6xJfP7-HCc
http://www.duodecimal.net/archives/duodecimal/duodecimal.html
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Duodecimal

attributes.action: Make pet owners legally liable when they attack pets in owners home.
attributes.background: Our cat Simba was attacked by a neighbours cat that entered our home and caused £1000 plus worth vet bills. But there is nothing legally we can do to ensure the owners stop the cat from enterting our home or attacking our cats! We want to raise awareness that this can happen!
attributes.additional_details: On Friday 10th March our cat was attacked by another cat that entered our home through an open window. The bite went through our cats hip. The infection from the back was very severe and he has spent 3 weeks recovering including one full week in the vets where they have had to flush out the wound every day. There isn't much legally we can do to get the owners of the cat to ensure that their cat doesn't attack our cats again in our own home. But we want to change this!

attributes.action: Expand the budget on specialisation in schools!
attributes.background: Schools have a limited amount of budget for specialised subjects like photography, art, music etc. They should be expanded to nurture youths creativity. England is a top creative country, by spending a limited amount of money on such a subject you're limiting a young child's creativity.

attributes.action: Increase the age of living in residential care to 21
attributes.background: We need to stop removing and kicking out just turned 18 year olds from care and residential homes. I myself was in care up until the end of January this year, my previous carers were then sent an email stating to "make him homeless". It's now ultimately harder to pursue education and find a home.

attributes.action: Make all UK commercial Banks publicly disclose ALL their customers fraud losses
attributes.background: Banks should be mandated that all fraud losses of their customers are disclosed publicly. This would focus them to protect their customers funds and data more securely. This should be disclosed on their Annual Reports as how many customers and how big each loss (without disclosing customer details)
attributes.additional_details:
Mostly, the only time these losses come to light is when a customer goes to the media because the banks will not pay their money back. eg

https://www.thesun.co.uk/money/3140302/santander-bank-refuses-to-refund-three-customers-who-lost-thousands-from-text-message-scam/

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/personal-banking/current-accounts/i-was-robbed-of-17500--the-bank-refunded-me-10p/

Banks take losses as a cost of doing business instead of investing in solutions to protect their customers money

attributes.action: Classify acid as an offensive weapon and increase sentences for acid attacks.
attributes.background: Corrosive liquids can be bought easily in DIY stores or online and disguised in drinks bottles. In law, a stabbing is an attempted murder, while an acid attack is only GBH. There's no specific offence regarding acid attacks, even though the impact on the victim can be far worse than a stabbing.
attributes.additional_details:
As reported by the BBC, there has been a sharp rise in attacks involving corrosive fluids in London over the last four years.

Since the start of 2017 there have been 49 crimes where "corrosive fluids" were thrown with "intent to cause grievous bodily harm" or to "cause an explosion".

attributes.action: Adapt law so all businesses charge for plastic bags
attributes.background: UK law doesn't require businesses with less than 250 employees to charge for plastic bags, but can do so voluntarily. Having worked at such a shop, they don't feel obliged to help save the environment if they're not forced to act. A voluntary basis isn't working thus a mandatory basis is required.
attributes.additional_details: In one shift (6.5 hrs) I would hand out 100-150 plastic bags for free. More often than not, 2 people are on the till at one time, 2 shifts are run per day, 7 days a week. This amounts to 2,800-4,200 bags handed out per week. Whilst the government have made excellent steps to make large businesses charge for their plastic bags, it is still critical every business participates to care for our environment. People expect to pay for a plastic bag, we now need that final push to reduce our usage.

attributes.action: Drivers who get banned to need to retake their driving test again
attributes.background: Drivers who have their driving license taken off them should be required to take their driving test again with set min amount of driving lessons as a new driver and driving license to be different colour.

attributes.action: Ban breast enlargement and cosmetic surgery ads from Daytime TV
attributes.background: young girls are being targeted by marketing teams across the UK as they encourage women to change their bodies to gain confidence. Help stop cosmetic surgery ads from being played during day time hours and encouraging our children to think badly of their body for not being "amazing" like on the ads.
attributes.additional_details: As if it isn't hard enough to raise our daughters to love themselves there are now TV ads encouraging women to change their bodies to gain confidence. And if this wasn't hard enough for adults to deal with, the ads being played during the days at weekends mean many young girls are becoming self conscious of their bodies from a young age. Is this an innocent mistake or  purposely planting the seed of hate in to a child's head to gain a future customer?

attributes.action: Only allow people between the ages 16 - 55 to vote.
attributes.background: By not allowing anyone over fifty to vote we give the younger generally the chance to make change, elderly people tend to be set in their ways and the country needs fresh mindsets, minds that are young and haven't been shaped by the world's media over the years, let the young have a say!
attributes.additional_details: We're all well and fine to charge teenagers tax for living independently, for working, or driving, but to say they have to help towards the government when the Government doesn't allow us to have a say in the country we contribute to is completely unfair.

attributes.action: Get Scotland its independence without a referendum
attributes.background: The Prime Minister has blocked any referendum for the people of Scotland.  Since when did the PM know what the Scottish people want.  She clearly does not.
attributes.additional_details: We the Scottish people have been lied to by Westminster.  Westminster lied to us about our oil running out.  We are being dragged out of the EU against our will.  Scotland was told it would have new powers and still nothing.  We the Scottish people want our Independence.

attributes.action: Call a UK wide referendum on Scottish independence by the end of 2018.
attributes.background: I believe more people in England would like Scotland to become an independent nation than those in Scotland itself.
attributes.additional_details: Each year Scotland spends more than its entire GDP, this overspend is covered by the rest of the UK, by making Scotland leave the UK the rest of the UK will gain billions of pounds which could be spent more wisely.

attributes.action: right to stay in your council/housing association home for life
attributes.background: The government is trying to introduce legislation to review all social housing tenants on need for their home. This needs stopping -  a home should be for life.  Please support.

attributes.action: Make coaching for the 11+ part of the curriculum to create an even playing field
attributes.background: With talk of building more grammar schools it is more important than ever that they are available to all and not just those that can afford private schools or to have their children coached. Coach-proof exams will not work, coaching all children is the only way to ensure the system is fair for all.

attributes.action: Remove the lower limit on the nil band Class 4 National Insurance contributions.
attributes.background: This is a separate matter to the Spring 2017 budget. From 2018 those earning < £5,965 must pay £733 p.a. (£14.10/w) for National Security via Class 3 National Insurance Contributions (NICs) while, unfairly, those earning more (£5,965-£8,060) will pay £0 to access them via a nil band on Class 4 NICs.
attributes.additional_details:
1. Ref: https://www.gov.uk/government/consultations/consultation-on-abolishing-class-2-national-insurance-and-introducing-a-contributory-benefit-test-to-class-4-national-insurance-for-the-self-employed/the-abolition-of-class-2-national-insurance-introducing-a-benefit-test-into-class-4-national-insurance-for-the-self-employed, accessed 16th March 2017.

2. Ref: https://www.aat.org.uk/prod/s3fs-public/assets/AAT_response_toConsultationonClass2NICabolition2016.pdf, accessed 16th March 2017.

attributes.action: Review Used Car Warranty Policies, they refuse claims unfairly and never pay out
attributes.background: These warranty claims companies offer mostly 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5 star policies, the cost of the policy and coverage depends on the level of cover you purchase, whenever a claim is made, there first reply is " that's not covered " In most cases they refuse as it's wear and tear, well its a used car !!.
attributes.additional_details: History of used car warranties the injectors failed, the EGR valve failed, brake callipers have seized, the brake discs failed, the gear box was slipping and needed transmission fluid change and trani doctor added to fix it, this should have been a gearbox change, but they said it's a service issue or it's wear and tear so not covered, DPF failed, not covered, these warranties don't cover attempting to find the problem, they won't pay for trying to find the fault, these warranties are a scandal

attributes.action: As we can't agree what we voted for in the EURef redo it with better question.
attributes.background: 'Leave the EU' was the question, but Ll the answers seem to be very different. It was too vague a question and the ambiguity is causing too much pain to ALL. Let's do it again with a better question and 16+ vote.

attributes.action: Allow UK citizens to volunteer for Jury service.
attributes.background: Having completed jury service I'm surprised that you cannot volunteer.  I have shared my experience with friends/colleagues and the overriding response is 'I would love to do Jury service'.  During my jury service I saw others who had been summoned drop out meaning the whole case was abandoned.
attributes.additional_details: The volunteer scheme would involve people being able to let the Court Service know they are interested and available to take part in this interesting and important civic duty.  It could be run in addition to the summons scheme.  This would allow UK citizens who want to commit to Jury service let the Court service, who need jurors, know they are interested.

attributes.action: Say no to school bags!
attributes.background: This petition is about making school bags optional,children lose interest in coming to school with the stress of carrying heavy bags. Carrying very heavy school bags can lead to musculoskeletal problems.
attributes.additional_details: School bags are too heavy for students, the solution to this problem is to every school being provided with lockers that are free or having e-books/Ipads.

attributes.action: Amend British Summer Time start date.
attributes.background: Amend British Summer Time to be the period beginning at one o'clock, Greenwich mean time, in the morning of the first Sunday in March and ending at one o'clock, Greenwich mean time, in the morning of the last Sunday in October.

attributes.action: Need more consumer protection for airline & travel bookings.
attributes.background: People spend thousands of pounds buying air tickets & making travel bookings. Strangely there is no consumer protection whatsoever. There must a period of atleast 14 days when the consumer has the ability to cancel their purchase and get a full refund in line with distance selling regulations.
attributes.additional_details: The vast majority of the airline tickets are 100% non refundable which means the consumer has no recourse to change their mind. Given that most people book several months in advance, there is a high likelyhood of changes to travel plans. The current system is so heavily against the consumer & is is inherently unfair. Why should airlines and travel companies enjoy such unprecented priveleges? I call upon the government to legistate for better rights to consumers in this regard.
